FeatureSelectorStatistic¶

class housing.data_processing.api.FeatureSelectorStatistic(statistic='f_score', k=2)¶

Base class for feature selection using the statistics.

Parameters

  • statistic ({"f_score", "chi_square",) –

    “corr_coef”, “corr_ratio”,

    ”cramer_v”, “f_score”, “mutual_value”, “woe_iv”} str, default = “f_score”.

    The statistic which will be used to select the top k columns.

  • k (int, optional, default=2) – Number of top features to select.

  • x_train (dataframe) – dataframe for train data

  • y_train (Series or np.array) – target data

Examples

>>> from housing.data_processing.feature_selection import FeatureSelectorStatistic
>>> from sklearn.datasets import make_regression
>>> X, y = make_regression(n_samples=1000, n_features=4,
...                            n_informative=2,
...                            random_state=0, shuffle=False)
>>> fs = FeatureSelectorStatistic()
>>> fs.fit(X,y)
FeatureSelectorStatistic(...)
>>> feature_scores = fs.scores_
>>> transformed_df = fs.transform(X)

Methods

FeatureSelectorStatistic.__init__([statistic, k])

Initialize Estimator.

FeatureSelectorStatistic.fit(X, y[, …])

Run score function on (X, y) and get the appropriate features.

FeatureSelectorStatistic.fit_transform(X[, y])

Fit to data, then transform it.

FeatureSelectorStatistic.get_params([deep])

Get parameters for this estimator.

FeatureSelectorStatistic.get_support([indices])

Get a mask, or integer index, of the features selected

FeatureSelectorStatistic.inverse_transform(X)

Reverse the transformation operation

FeatureSelectorStatistic.set_params(**params)

Set the parameters of this estimator.

FeatureSelectorStatistic.transform(X)

Reduce X to the selected features.
